snippet: While surveying the damage done by vandals at the famed Green-Wood Cemetery in Brooklyn, a historian finds gifts left for the prodigious composer Leonard Bernstein.
abstract: Francis X Clines The City Life column on discovery, by historian Jeff Richman, of gifts left by unknown admirers at the grave of Leonard Bernstein in Brooklyn's Green-wood Cemetery; says tributes, unlike recent acts of vandalism at this historic gem of a cemetery, hark back to the founding aura of Green-Wood in the 19th century, when New Yorkers came by horse and carriage to picnic at family plots in a rural setting.
lead_paragraph: While surveying the damage done by vandals at the famed Green-Wood Cemetery in Brooklyn, a historian finds gifts left for the prodigious composer Leonard Bernstein.
